H0.text: A solution is magnesium oxide, which is produced when magnesium metal is burned in the presence of oxygen and whose properties differ from those of magnesium and oxygen.

H1.text: A mixture is magnesium oxide, which is produced when magnesium metal is burned in the presence of oxygen and whose properties differ from those of magnesium and oxygen individually.

H2.text: Magnesium oxide is a compound produced when magnesium metal burns in the presence of oxygen, and its properties differ from the individual properties of magnesium and oxygen.

H3.text: An element is magnesium oxide, which is produced when magnesium metal is burned in the presence of oxygen and has properties that differ from those of magnesium and oxygen.

A4.text: Magnesium oxide is produced by the calcination of magnesium carbonate or magnesium hydroxide.

A5.text: Ionic compounds typically have high melting and boiling points, and are hard and brittle.

A6.text: Ionic bonds occur when valence electrons are completely transferred between elements.
